title: ParseError with ShadowDOM selectors ^^, ^
body:
I tried to modify **Bootstrap** so that it works with **Polymer** elements.
Polymer elements introduce a **ShadowDOM** boundary which breaks descendant/child-selectors. To make such selectors work the **^** (hat - one boundery) **^^** (cat all boundaries) are needed in between.

`body ^^ .panel-group` selects all `.panel-group`-elements no matter how many shadowDOM levels it encapsulated with.

After **adding a hat or cat selector** in one of the Bootsrap less source files I get **this error**:

```
Running "less:compileCore" (less) task
>> ParseError: Unrecognised input in less/panels.less on line 152, column 6:
>> 151 
>> 152 body ^ .panel-group {
>> 153   margin-bottom: @line-height-computed;
```

Do you have any plans to support these selectors?
I'm new to less.
Maybe there is an easy solution/workaround that I am not aware of.
### Below a few links about this topic:
- [Polymer - A Guide to Styling Elements - From outside the element](http://www.polymer-project.org/articles/styling-elements.html#style-fromoutside)
- [Rob Dodson talks internets - The Cat and the Hat CSS Selectors](http://robdodson.me/blog/2013/11/15/the-cat-and-the-hat-css-selectors/)
- [Shadow DOM - W3C Working Draft 14 May 2013](http://www.w3.org/TR/shadow-dom/)
- [Introduction to Web Components - W3C Working Draft 6 June 2013](http://www.w3.org/TR/components-intro/)
- [shadow-dom - Update on Shadow DOM's interaction with CSS](http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2013Nov/0313.html)
- [w3c / webcomponents GitHub repo - Shadow :part and @host are dead. Long live hats (^) and cats (^^) aâ€¦](https://github.com/w3c/webcomponents/commit/7bcf227a2880a102854eb842455849905b521938)
